title: Deal to restore democratic transition in Sudan delayed again
description: A dispute between Sudan’s military and a paramilitary group has forced the delay of a deal with politicians aimed at restoring the country’s democratic transition, which was derailed by a 2021 coup

title: Ex-Canadian PM Mulroney recovering from prostate cancer
description: Former Canadian Prime Minister Brian Mulroney is recovering after undergoing treatment in Montreal for prostate cancer

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro questioned about gifts of diamond jewelry
description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has undergone questioning about diamond jewelry gifts when he was in power, as part of an investigation into whether he engaged in any irregularities in bringing the items into Brazil

title: 5 arrested after suspected cartel killings near Cancún beach resort
description: Four alleged drug dealers who died outside an all-inclusive Cancún resort 'were executed on the spot,’ a person close to the investigation says

title: Six in Puerto Rico indicted in $9M scheme targeting US funds
description: Officials say a federal grand jury in Puerto Rico has indicted six people accused in a $9 million fraudulent scheme involving government pandemic funds

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro arrives at police base for diamonds probe
description: Brazil’s former President Jair Bolsonaro entered the Federal Police headquarters in capital Brasilia on Wednesday to provide testimony regarding diamond jewelry gifts incorporated into the president’s personal collection

title: Wall Street Journal reporter ‘wrongfully detained’ by Russia, Blinken says
description: Evan Gershkovich, a reporter in the Journal's Moscow bureau, was accused of gathering information about a Russian military enterprise, claims the newspaper has rejected.

title: As bankruptcy ends, board seeks to boost Puerto Rico economy
description: A federal control board that oversees Puerto Rico’s finances says it will focus on growing the island’s economy as the U.S. territory emerges from a drawn-out bankruptcy process

title: France to put 3 Syrians on trial for crimes against humanity
description: The French anti-terrorism prosecutor’s office says France has issued arrest warrants for three high-ranking Syrian intelligence officers

title: Mexico's president calls charges against Trump political
description: Mexico’s president says he opposes the charges brought against former U.S. president Donald Trump

title: Klaus Teuber, creator of Catan board game empire, dies at 70
description: The game, said Mr. Teuber, was inspired by his fascination with Viking exploration.

title: Spain: Alleged smugglers of defense material to Russia held
description: Spanish police have detained one Russian national and one Ukrainian national for their alleged smuggling of defense material to Russia

title: Hatchet-wielding man kills four children at Brazil day-care center, authorities say
description: Three boys and a girl between the ages of 4 and 7 died in the assault on the Cantinho do Bom Pastor day care center in Blumenau, 370 miles southeast of São Paulo.

title: Taliban bars Afghan women from working for U.N., organization says
description: In a statement, the U.N. condemned the move as “cruel,” “unlawful” and “an unparalleled violation of women’s rights.”

title: Why an Israeli raid on al-Aqsa Mosque is stoking tensions
description: The Temple Mount or al-Aqsa Mosque compound lies at the heart of the struggle between Israelis and Palestinians over Jerusalem. Israeli forces raided the site during Ramadan.

title: Putin: West helped Ukraine mount acts of sabotage
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin accuses Western intelligence agencies of helping Ukraine to carry out acts of sabotage

title: Prince Harry due to testify in phone hacking case in June
description: Prince Harry is expected to testify in a London courtroom in June in one of his phone hacking lawsuits against British tabloids

title: South Africa ends 'state of disaster' over electricity
description: The South African government has terminated the national state of disaster it declared two months ago to deal with an electricity crisis, although there are no signs that the power problems are ending

title: 'Famine-like conditions': 13 die in South Sudan, says agency
description: An aid agency in South Sudan says that famine-like conditions the country’s southeast have left 13 people dead due to lack of food and water

title: Spain: suspect in church attacks sent to psychiatric center
description: A Spanish judge orders that a Moroccan man held for killing a church officer in January in the southern city of Algeciras be examined at a psychiatric center

title: UN: Ban on Afghan female staffers by Taliban unacceptable
description: The U.N. says it cannot accept a Taliban decision to bar Afghan female staffers from working at the agency, calling it an “unparalleled” violation of women’s rights

title: Taiwan’s president met with U.S. lawmakers as China warned about McCarthy session
description: Several lawmakers confirmed they met with Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen last week. Tsai is scheduled to meet with House Speaker Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) on Wednesday.

title: UN nuclear chief discusses Ukraine nuclear plant in Russia
description: U.N. nuclear head Rafael Grossi has met with Russian officials in Kaliningrad for negotiations on the safety of Ukraine’s Moscow-held Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant

title: At least 21 dead in Somalia's flash floods, says U.N. agency
description: The U.N. humanitarian agency says that at least 21 people, including six children, have died in Somalia’s flash flooding over the last week

title: Should influencers fess up about their filters? France may force them to.
description: The bill in the French Parliament would make influencers disclose filter use, and ban them from paid promotion of cosmetic surgery or some financial products.

title: Man in Brazil kills 4 children, injures 3 at daycare center
description: Authorities say a man invaded a daycare center with a hatchet, killing four children and injuring at least three in southern Brazil

title: Coronation invitation calls Camilla ‘Queen.’ Her path there wasn’t easy.
description: King Charles III’s coronation invitation, which features the couple’s coats of arms, calls the king’s wife “Queen Camilla” for the first time.

title: Turkey closes airspace to flights using north Iraqi airport
description: A top official says Turkey has closed its airspace to flights to and from an airport in Kurdish-administered northern Iraq

title: Activist who ran for Belarusian presidency pleads guilty
description: An opposition politician who ran against authoritarian Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko in the controversial 2020 presidential election has pleaded guilty at the start of his trial on charges of public order breaches

title: QatarEnergy to acquire 25% stake in major Iraqi gas project
description: QatarEnergy, the Gulf country’s state-run petroleum firm, has agreed to buy a 25% stake in a massive gas project in Iraq

title: Japan police arrest 2 in food prank at beef bowl diner
description: Japanese police have arrested two men who posted a clip in which one of them is eating ginger from a communal container with his chopsticks at a famous beef bowl restaurant

title: Veteran Spanish actress says surrogate baby is granddaughter
description: A heated debate in Spain triggered by a 68-year-old Spanish celebrity who was reported to have used a surrogate mother in Miami to have a baby has taken a twist with the woman announcing in a socialite magazine that the baby is actually the daughter of her son who died of cancer in 2020

title: As Finland joins its ranks NATO ponders Ukraine's prospects
description: Finland has joined NATO, abandoning a history of military nonalignment for protection from Russia under the organization’s security umbrella

title: Foreign veterinarians save sick elephant at Pakistani zoo
description: A veterinarian says experts have saved a sick elephant at a zoo in southern Pakistan

title: Top Bosnian government official convicted of abuse of office
description: A top Bosnian government official and two others have been convicted and given prison sentences over the procurement at highly inflated prices of inadequate medical equipment during the COVID-19 pandemic

title: China watches Trump courtroom drama: A ‘premium show without paywall’
description: The former president's arraignment brought rare entertainment to the tightly controlled Chinese internet, and state media didn't miss a chance to pile on.

title: UN officials condemn Taliban ban on female Afghan staffers
description: United Nations officials are condemning a Taliban decision to bar female Afghan employees from working at the agency

title: Report: Husband of ex-Scottish leader arrested
description: British media are reporting that the husband of former Scottish first minister and Scottish National Party leader Nicola Sturgeon has been arrested in a party finance probe

title: Cargo ship sinks off Turkish coast, 9 crew members missing
description: Turkish officials say a Guinea-Bissau-flagged cargo ship with 14 crew members on board has sunk off Turkey’s Mediterranean coast

title: Jacinda Ardern quits politics, joins Prince William’s environment charity
description: New Zealand’s ex-leader, after a final speech to Parliament, will work with the "Christchurch Call" to fight online extremism and the prince’s Earthshot Prize.

title: Israeli strikes on Syria intensify, raise tensions with Iran
description: Israel has intensified its airstrikes in Syria in recent weeks, killing two Iranian military advisers and temporarily putting the country’s two largest international airports out of service

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky to visit Poland; West celebrates Finland’s NATO accession
description: The Ukrainian president's trip to Warsaw comes as French President Emmanuel Macron is set to arrive in Beijing with a warning against giving Russia weapons.

title: Violence at Jerusalem mosque prompts fears of wider fighting
description: Israeli police have stormed the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem’s Old City, firing stun grenades and beating Palestinian youths who hurled stones and firecrackers in a burst of violence during a sensitive holiday seasons

title: Macron and Europe hedge their bets on China
description: Frances Emmanuel Macron heads to China on a complicated mission, keen to enlist Chinese leader Xi Jinping in the pursuit of checking Russia’s war while hoping to boost economic ties.
